Meeting Title: Oregon Transportation Safety Committee (OTSC)
Short Description: Under ORS 802.300: (1) The Transportation Safety Committee is created within the Department of Transportation to advise the department and the Oregon Transportation Commission concerning the functions described under ORS 802.310 and to perform any other functions related to transportation safety that the commission delegates. The committee established under this section shall consist of five members appointed by the Governor on the recommendation of the commission. The term of office of each member is four years. Before the expiration of the term of a member, the Governor shall appoint a successor. A member is eligible for reappointment. In case of a vacancy for any cause, the Governor shall appoint a person to fill the office for the unexpired term.
Meeting Location: ODOT TLC in Salem or Virtually
Details: Please see weblink for more information.

Meeting Title: Historic Columbia River Highway Advisory Committee
Short Description: The Oregon Legislature created the Historic Columbia River Highway Advisory Committee in 1987 (ORS 366.550) to make recommendations to ODOT and OPRD concerning the Historic Highway.  Membership includes representatives from ODOT, OPRD, the State Historic Preservation Office, and the Oregon Tourism Commission. Six private citizens are on the committee, two from each of the three counties (Multnomah, Hood River and Wasco).
Meeting Location: Hood River County Library, 502 State Street and Zoom

Meeting Title: Connect Oregon Online Public Hearing
Details: Opportunity for interested parties to comment on this cycle of the Connect Oregon competitive grant program. Interested parties must sign-up to speak via the program website at http://www.oregon.gov/odot/Programs/Pages/ConnectOregon.aspx  Alternatively, for those who wish to comment but who are unable or do not wish to speak at the April 20 public meeting may choose to send in written comments to ODOT staff to be included as part of the record that goes to the Oregon Transportation Commission as part of the package of materials for Connect Oregon. Meeting link will be posted at program website.

Meeting Title: Connect Oregon Final Review Committee
Details:
The Final Review Committee (FRC) will deliberate and come to a recommendation on which projects to fund that the Oregon Transportation Commission should fund for the 2021 Connect Oregon competitive grant cycle. The FRC will review a combined list of recommendations from each modal committee (aviation, marine, rail and freight) and from the Region Review Committees from all 5 ODOT Regions. The FRC is charged with reviewing the 49 eligible projects totaling $126 million in requested funds and determining which projects best meet the statutory considerations for the program which focus on investment in non-highway modes of transportation that result in a more strong, diverse and efficient transportation system.
Detailed meeting information and access links will be posted on the program page at https://www.oregon.gov/odot/programs/pages/connectoregon.aspx

Meeting Title: Region 1 Area Commission on Transportation
Short Description: The Region 1 Area Commission on Transportation, also known as R1ACT, is an advisory body established to provide a forum for stakeholders to collaborate on transportation issues affecting Oregon Department of Transportation Region 1.
Details:
The Region 1 Area Commission on Transportation (ACT) will hold a virtual meeting from 5:30 to 7:30 p.m. on Monday, April 4, 2022.
At 5:15 p.m., we will test video and audio connections.
At 5:30 p.m., the meeting will begin.
Agenda topics include:
•	Legislative Short-Session Update.
•	Hood River Bridge Update. 
•	OTC Allocation of Federal Infrastructure Funds.

Short Description: ORS 802.300: (1) The Transportation Safety Committee is created within the Department of Transportation to advise the department and the Oregon Transportation Commission concerning the functions described under ORS 802.310 and to perform any other functions related to transportation safety that the commission delegates. The committee established under this section shall consist of five members appointed by the Governor on the recommendation of the commission. The term of office of each member is four years. Before the expiration of the term of a member, the Governor shall appoint a successor. A member is eligible for reappointment. In case of a vacancy for any cause, the Governor shall appoint a person to fill the office for the unexpired term.

The meeting will include general approval of the previous meeting minutes and consent calendar, member reports, a COVID-19 update, the 2021 Highway Safety Plan, a presentation on photo red light camera programs, introduction of Cooper Brown (Assistant Director of Delivery and Operations), transportation safety program updates, and approval for the proclamation/declaration of October Distracted Driving Awareness Month.

Meeting Title: Oregon Transportation Commission
Pedestrian & Bicycle Rules Advisory Committee (PB-RAC)
Short Description: Statute and Rule changes to ORS 367.082
Meeting Location: ODOT Transportation Building, 355 Capitol St NE, Room 103 -Gail L Achterman Commission Room
Details:
Oregon Legislature passed Keep Oregon Moving (House Bill 2017), which includes changes to the existing Connect Oregon Grant Fund (ORS 367.082) program that necessitates aligning the implementing rules with the new statutes. The legislation bifurcated the program into two new parts, with a separate allocation of 7% for bicycle and pedestrian transportation projects. Beyond the structural changes to the Connect Oregon program, HB 2017 charged the Department with streamlining the application process. 

The Connect Oregon Rules Advisory Committee is charged with updating Connect Oregon Administrative Rule Chapter 731 Division 35 to align with the legislative intent of the transportation funding package (HB 2017), under ORS 367.080 to 089. The Pedestrian and Bicycle Rules Advisory Committee will set up the administrative process for the 7 percent of Connect Oregon funds allocated for pedestrian and bicycle projects. The Committee with also advise on ways to streamline the application process. 

The Committee consists of representatives from the Oregon Bicycle and Pedestrian Advisory Committee, Oregon Public Transit Advisory Committee, Area Commissions on Transportation, state and local parks departments, state and local governments, and trails advocacy groups. A series of four to five meetings will include an overview of changes to Oregon Law made by the 2017 Legislature, discussing the committee's goals, local public engagement along with participation from local governments and public interest groups in the rule making process.
Public Comment Accepted: Yes, agenda time reserved for Public Comment

Meeting Title: Oregon Transportation Commission
Oregon Transportation Commission
Oregon Transportation Commission
Oregon Transportation Commission
Connect Oregon Dedicated Projects Review Committee
Meeting Location: ODOT Technical Leadership Center, Columbia Room, 4040 Fairview Industrial Dr. SE
Details: ODOT received six pre-proposals for the Connect Oregon dedicated projects related to the Mid-Willamette Valley Intermodal Facility and Treasure Valley Intermodal Facility as specified in HB 2017 in December 2017. Three of these prospective projects have declined to continue to participate in the process. The remaining three project sponsors submitted their proposals by the September 30, 2018 deadline. In accordance with OAR 731-035-0065, the proposals have been reviewed by a neutral third party with economic analysis expertise. On Friday, a Final Review Committee will meet to review the proposals and make a recommendation to the Oregon Transportation Commission. The Commission will hear about the recommendations at its February 21, 2019 meeting and is expected to make funding decisions at its March 21, 2019 meeting.

Meeting Title: Safe Routes to Schools- Rule Advisory Committee (SRTS-RAC)
Short Description: The Oregon Transportation Commission, or OTC, has formed a Rulemaking Advisory Committee to amend the Oregon Safe Routes to School Rule (OAR 737-025). The purpose of the committee is to align the rule with new funding made available by recent state legislation, and consider how infrastructure funding for Safe Routes to School should be structured. The committee is advisory to the Oregon Department of Transportation and OTC.
Meeting Location: Chemeketa Center for Business and Industry, 626 High St NE Room 103
Details: Meeting #6 Goals: Share progress of Outreach Events planned across the state; Review the draft rule update; Discuss public comments; Develop Program Guidance; Discuss next steps and timeline.

Meeting Title: Continuous Improvement Advisory Committee
Short Description: Advises the Oregon Transportation Commission on ways to improve the Oregon Department of Transportation.
Meeting Location: 355 Capitol St. NE, Transportation Bldg. Gail Achterman Room
Details: The committee helps develop key performance measures and reviews projects over $50 million. Committee recommendations and progress will be reported to the Oregon Legislature.

Meeting Title: Safe Routes to Schools- Rules Advisory Committee
Short Description: The Oregon Transportation Commission, or OTC, has formed a Rulemaking Advisory Committee to amend the Oregon Safe Routes to School Rule (OAR 737-025). The committee is advisory to the Oregon Department of Transportation and OTC.
Details: Meet #5 Goals: Agree on program structure such as project selection criteria, eligibility requirements, and solicitation process; Next Steps and Program timeline; Review OAR Revisions; and receive Public Comment.

Meeting Title: Oregon Freight Advisory Committee (OFAC)
Meeting Location: Chemeketa Center for Business and Industry, 626 High St NE
Details: The Oregon Freight Advisory Committee (OFAC) was appointed to advise the ODOT Director and Oregon Transportation Commission (OTC) on issues, policies and programs that impact multimodal freight mobility in Oregon. This includes identifying high-priority freight mobility projects for consideration in ODOT’s Statewide Transportation Improvement Programs (STIP) and for the ConnectOregon program. The Freight Advisory Committee also advises on transportation policy related to goods movement.

Meeting Title: Bicycle and Pedestrian Advisory Committee (OBPAC)
Short Description: OBPAC acts as a liason between the public and ODOT on the bicycle and pedestrian transportation system.
Details: This committe, appointed by the governor, acts as a liason between the public and ODOT. They advise ODOT in the regulation of bicycle and pedestrian traffic and the establishment of bikeways and walkways. The committee meets quarterly in various locations around the state to listen to the views and concerns of interested citizens, local officials and ODOT Region staff. ** This meeting will focus on the ODOT Legislative Priorities and BTA Legislative Agenda; hear from the NW Skate Coalition, Governor's Transportation Visioning Committe, Boards and Commissions and Connect Oregon V; STIP Enhance 2019-2021; N. Williams Projects.**

Details: This group helps improve public transit services by sharing their valuable experience, expertise, perspectives, and contacts with the Public Transit Division.
